title: Woman, 3-year-old shot on Cleveland's East Side
content:
Cleveland police confirmed that two people, a 24-year-old woman and a 3-year-old child, were shot in an apparent drive-by about 7 p.m. Tuesday on East 113th Street on Cleveland's East Side. The two were flown to MetroHealth Medical Center to receive treatment after being privately transported to the Cleveland Clinic.
CLEVELAND, Ohio -- Two people, a 24-year-old woman and a 3-year-old child, were shot Tuesday evening on Cleveland's East Side.
The victims were shot about 7 p.m. while they were in a car on East 113th Street, between Union and Regalia avenues, Cleveland Police Chief Calvin Williams said. The two were taken to the Cleveland Clinic in a private vehicle before being taken to MetroHealth Medical Center by a Life Flight helicopter.
The condition of the victims, who were not identified, was unknown, Williams said late Tuesday.
Police were told by witnesses that the woman and the 3-year-old were inside a parked vehicle on East 113th Street when another car pulled up and someone inside opened fire, Williams said.
Witnesses told police that the second vehicle is a light-colored four-door sedan, possibly a Toyota, Williams said.
No information about suspects was available.
All of East 113th Street between Union and Regalia avenues remained cordoned off as of 11 p.m.
Less than two weeks ago, on Sept. 4, 5-year-old Ramon Burnett was shot and killed while playing football in a small courtyard behind his grandmother's home on Louise Harris Drive in Cleveland's Central neighborhood.
Marlon Hackett, Jr., 19, and Dontavious Williams, 18, have been charged with aggravated murder in connection with Ramon's death. They are both being held on $1 million bond.
